alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; West Central Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 11 at 2:19PM MST until December 14 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Boise
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 20 to 30 inches above 4000 feet MSL, with 3 to 4 feet over higher mountain passes. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches below 4000 feet MSL. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph, causing localized reductions in visibility. * WHERE...Boise Mountains and West Central Mountains zones. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This is a long duration winter storm with multiple periods of heavy snow. The heaviest snow is expected tonight through Sunday morning, although there will be additional periods of heavy snow through Tuesday. There could be lulls Sunday afternoon and during the day on Monday. Additionally, snow levels will rise to around 4000 feet MSL on Sunday and 5000 feet MSL on Monday, limiting snowfall accumulation below these elevations on these days. Snow will fall at all elevations on Tuesday as a cold front moves through the area.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
